description: This work is among Cy Twombly’s best-known and earliest sculptures. Once painted stark white, it is now evocatively weathered. The work presents a fence-like array of spoon handles and other shafts of wood that were wrapped together with bands of cloth and mounted on a stepped platform. It can be read—either separately or simultaneously—as depicting a powerful “fetish” object, a set of mute panpipes, or an unidentified archaeological fragment.
title: Untitled, New York
